message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.NI, cs.DC 

The paper discusses cyber-attacks on power grids, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The attacks involve changing the breaker statuses on transmission lines to affect the estimation of the grid topology, which requires a system-level understanding of the power grid and its control mechanisms, indicating a systems and control (cs.SY) aspect to the research. The paper proposes a novel graph-coloring based analysis to study the feasibility of the attacks, which involves algorithmic and computational aspects, suggesting an artificial intelligence (cs.AI) component. The attacks also involve blocking recorded measurements on certain lines from being transmitted to the control center, which involves network infrastructure (cs.NI) considerations. Finally, the paper discusses simulations on IEEE test cases, which involves the use of computational tools and techniques, indicating a distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC) aspect to the research.
